reviewText:
Early Access Review

Shakedown Racing. Well what can I say, this is a subparearly access title with a bitter after taste and one salty developer.

My original review for this game was i paid 99 centsand all i got was problems". Most of you would be able to pick up theundertone of Jay-Z's - 99 Problems and for those who didn't
date: I suggestyou start here with the music video. Yes- my original review was based on lyrics from a song which was then alteredto fit in some connection with the game. The first one being the fact that I paid 99 cents and the second one being that I encountered issues.\n\nShortly there was a response from the developer
recommended:
"You're quoting someone or what? What problems did you have? How did you pay 99 cents? The game has never been selling for 99 cents. You should be reported."

It was at this point I felt bad for the review I had posted so I decided to shed some light on the review and provided him with specific feedback on where the problems were and even went as far as offering to PM him and provide the information on where I'd purchased the game but these offers fell upon deaf ears and were shortly followed up with more nit-picking and allegations of piracy.

This now places me in a position where I have worked upon my meme-like review to provide useful information about the software that I purchased only to be told that I was the issue that I was and had supported piracy. Thank you Danail Zotov
hoursPlayed:
maybe you should think about the terms you are usingto describe someone who out of the thousands of games on Steam bought and then went out of their way to offer support through multiple channels upon request.

This is the first and last game I will bother supporting in any form that is released from this developer.

P.S. The game was bought from HRK Game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's not bad but I currently wouldn't recommended it for the simple fact of the controls

Cons
->> It's so incredibly clunky and un-natural to stear - UPDATE: Improved but still needs some work

Only Minor cons IMO
- There's no option for manual
- No RPM meter
- No Speedometer
- No 'free roam' (or mess around area) just to drive around in
- No brake lights (it would even be better if the rear-view red dots would glow a brighter red)
- No controller support

Pros
- Nicely detailed
- Interesting graphics
- Different game modes
- A big choice of cars

When the game gets an update so will the review and it may change (hopefully) but for now, I cannot recommend this game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game has great potential, for day one early access it is a great game. With some improvements and fixes this game can and will be great. It is not by any means a finished game, but as long as the dev keeps up and works on it this game is looking good.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Really great physics in this game.  It is top notch compared to other indie racing games.  Also the pastel-colours create a very nice prominent art style which sets this game apart from others.  Another great thing is how there are numerous different modes of racing, so it is not just the same thing over and over.  It's also ruthlessly hard, as the description will indicate, your skills are required.  Make a mistake and you pay the price.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C-lJHdwVA9I
Now it is still in early access, so that greyed-out multiplayer button in the main menu would be absolutely amazing to experience.  I hope they can add that to the game at some point in the near future so we can try this out.  This game has a promising future!

In my short experience, I was not able to find a game mode where you race against AI cars.  Just against the clock.  I would love to hear that this is already in the game somewhere, because I feel that this is required of a good racer.  But as-is, there is some fun to be had here doing the challenges.

Gripes: controller support is broken.  I had to use keyboard and mouse, which was upsetting.  The arrow keys on the keyboard and so without analog controls it is a huge setback.  Since the game is only a few days old, we'll cut it that slack.  But I think that would be the first thing this game needs fixed.

Also, there were some frame drops in some areas.  Very capable system getting a rock solid 60 FPS and it would suddenly die down to 15 FPS during a turn.  These areas were few and far between so it was not a rough ride just a thing to note.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This, is up there with games with the most potential. And in a good way. (Probably top 5).

It really is brilliant, it's not perfect, but it's early acces. So it's not going to be. Especially by a small developer. But for a small developer this is absolutely one of the more impressive games out there.


It's fun, quick, challenging. And it does have partial controller support, (don't use the triggers, use the second analog stick).

This game has the potential to be one of the greater games of 2016.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TDLR: Do not buy. Not worth 99 Cents let alone the 8.00 dollars being asked.

First off, I take no pleasure in this review, no unlike the game.

The campaign mode" is terrible. It looks like a mediocre track created in a better games track creator mode. The physics are terrible. The Gates simply push you through the ground and the balls serve no purpose (As far as I was able to get). I could not get past the 1st race
date:
but perhaps I'm just a noob.

One of the worst things was the camera work. Never seemed to show what you needed to see.

As for the other mode
recommended: it is a tad more fun. However it seems to be a poor attempt to clone Rocket League. All the same issues apply to this mode.\n\nOn the good side
